fullText:
The theater’s most famous nose is mentioned only twice in the new musical “Cyrano,” which opened Thursday at Off Broadway’s Daryl Roth Theatre. Presented by the New Group, Erica Schmidt’s adaptation of the Edmond Rostand classic dismisses the big schnoz as soon as Peter Dinklage says, “What woman could love me with this this” — he pauses to make a large, sweeping gesture over his body — “nose?”

There’s a novel twist on size here, since Dinklage plays the title role with no facial padding.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This review is about an Off-Broadway production at Daryl Roth Theatre, not a Broadway show; openai: The review is about an Off-Broadway production at the Daryl Roth Theatre, not the current Broadway run.; gemini: This review is for an off-Broadway production, not the Broadway production.; kimi: The review explicitly states the show opened at Off Broadway's Daryl Roth Theatre and is presented by the New Group, not a current Broadway production.
